doc.previous: In terms of phytogeography Croatia is a part of the Boreal Kingdom and is a part of Illyrian and Central European provinces of the Circumboreal Region and the Adriatic province of the Mediterranean Region The World Wide Fund for Nature divides Croatia between three ecoregions Pannonian mixed forests Dinaric Mountains mixed forests and Illyrian deciduous forests 87
doc.after: There are 37 000 known species in Croatia but their actual number is estimated to be between 50 000 and 100 000 86 The claim is supported by nearly 400 new taxa of invertebrates discovered in Croatia in the first half of the 2000s decade alone 86 There are more than a thousand endemic species especially in Velebit and Biokovo mountains Adriatic islands and karst rivers Legislation protects 1 131 species 86
